page.title: 14The Miners' Strike
page.content: The miners' strike didn't affect our close families, but rather our other family, Askern Swimming Club.The boilers needed coal to heat the water, but because of the strike we didn't get any. Thus, of course, the water was freezing, making swimming impossible. Therefore we entered a 6 month swimless period. During this period however, Carl and I went to the volleyball set-up in Campsall Village Hall. These sessions were good but nowhere as good as swimming. Other pools, however, were still open around Doncaster and so we could go to inter_club galas. However, because of the lack of training we didn't win any. Our personal best times didn't improve much. When the pool reopened after 6 months Carl left the swimming club but I stayed.
